channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris tries to flip the script on Trump on the border during raucous Georgia speech
item.description: The issue of border security is one of Vice President Harris' biggest vulnerabilities in her campaign. On Tuesday, she tried to use his signature issue against former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The issue of border security is one of Vice President Harris' biggest vulnerabilities in her campaign. On Tuesday, she tried to use his signature issue against former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: John Bazemore)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Project 2025's director steps down, but the think tank says work will go on
item.description: The Trump campaign, which has tried to disavow the project despite links to it, said in a statement that “reports of Project 2025’s demise would be greatly welcomed."
item.content:encoded:
The Trump campaign, which has tried to disavow the project despite links to it, said in a statement that “reports of Project 2025’s demise would be greatly welcomed."

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: The U.S. men's soccer team advances to the quarterfinals at the Paris Olympics
item.description: The U.S. men's team defeated Guinea 3-0 to advance to the knockout round in an Olympics for the first time since the Sydney Games in 2000. The Americans will face Morocco Friday in the quarterfinals.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. men's team defeated Guinea 3-0 to advance to the knockout round in an Olympics for the first time since the Sydney Games in 2000. The Americans will face Morocco Friday in the quarterfinals.

(Image credit: Tullio M. Puglia)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: Ex-NFL star Terrell Davis and United offer differing accounts of his ban from airline
item.description: The Hall of Famer says he's been banned from future United Airlines flights after an incident earlier this month. But the airline says the ban was lifted almost immediately.
item.content:encoded:
The Hall of Famer says he's been banned from future United Airlines flights after an incident earlier this month. But the airline says the ban was lifted almost immediately.

(Image credit: Cindy Ord)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump's planned address to Black journalists convention sparks backlash
item.description: Former President Donald Trump will address journalists at the NABJ convention in Chicago. Many, however, have questioned the decision to offer a platform to the Republican nominee.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump will address journalists at the NABJ convention in Chicago. Many, however, have questioned the decision to offer a platform to the Republican nominee.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Former comms director for Kamala Harris reflects on 'tough environment'
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with journalist Gil Duran, who was communications director for Vice President Kamala Harris when she was California’s state attorney general.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with journalist Gil Duran, who was communications director for Vice President Kamala Harris when she was California’s state attorney general.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: Simone Biles officially wins more Olympic medals than any gymnast in U.S. history
item.description: Women's gymnastics took centerstage at the Paris Olympics for one of the Games' marquee events. All eyes were on Simone Biles and the U.S. squad as they competed in the gymnastics team final.
item.content:encoded: Women's gymnastics took centerstage at the Paris Olympics for one of the Games' marquee events. All eyes were on Simone Biles and the U.S. squad as they competed in the gymnastics team final.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Money for medals: Countries give their Olympians cash bonuses for winning
item.description: For most countries, many medal-winning athletes receive a hefty financial bonus. The amount depends — but can reaches upwards of $200,000 for some nations.
item.content:encoded: For most countries, many medal-winning athletes receive a hefty financial bonus. The amount depends — but can reaches upwards of $200,000 for some nations.
item.dc:creator: Jonas Adams

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro threatens reprisals as disputed election protests become deadly
item.description: As Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro claims an unverifiable victory, anti-government protests there grow.
item.content:encoded:
As Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro claims an unverifiable victory, anti-government protests there grow.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Kamala Harris’ campaign is reaching out to specific types of male voters
item.description: Campaigns don’t often reach out to male voters as men. At least on the Democratic side, that changed when Kamala Harris became the party’s likely nominee.
item.content:encoded: Campaigns don’t often reach out to male voters as men. At least on the Democratic side, that changed when Kamala Harris became the party’s likely nominee.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben
